Why are drugs bad?

Avoiding drugs is crucial for your physical, mental, and social well-being. Here's why:

  • Health Risks: drugs can damage vital organs, weaken your immune system, and lead to chronic diseases.
  • Mental Health: They often worsen anxiety, depression, and other mental health issues, while impairing cognitive functions.
  • Addiction: drugs are highly addictive, leading to loss of control and dependence.

Choosing not to use drugs helps you maintain control over your life and ensures a healthier, happier future.
